item.title: Irresponsibly parked e scooters, 30th April
item.description:
Over the last 3 days e scooters have been left outside my front door obstructing the narrow pavement. The designated parking is over the road on a wide pavement outside a non residential building. I have contacted Voi e who run the scooters but no response. There is no space now for me to put my bins out without totally blocking the pavement. Please can you have them removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bath Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12 inch potholes Hewlett Road, 30th April
item.description:
Outside 149 Hewlett Road, 2 approximately 12 inch potholes. I have reported these previously also made a follow up, not entirely sure all repots were received, as bikes with child trailers go over the potholes, a drain like clang occurs and the harsh "bump" I would say requires smoothing for such purposes. Some transport having possibly had previous experience, preserving their tyres/suspension etc, appear to go slightly around the potholes. There is a pothole marked opposite my home, corner of Aeriel Lodge road. Also a pothole outside neighbouring property 151, where a road drain grate is positioned. It seems logical, common sense, costs, man power, for the mentioned potholes to be dealt with at the same time. Issues appear to have been present over past several months approximately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pittville Circus Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
